definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Tailor your presentations; don't be generic.
sentences.chinese: 量身订做你的自我陈述，不要大众化。

sentences.english: The value orientation and objective effect of Liang Qichao's thought in popularization.
sentences.chinese: 梁启超大众化文学思想的价值取向与客观效果。

sentences.english: The higher education massification attracts attention on higher education quality.
sentences.chinese: 高等教育大众化引起人们对高等教育质量的关注。

sentences.english: Massification represents a major change in Chinese higher education in the early years of the 21st Century.
sentences.chinese: 大众化是21世纪初期我国高等教育变革的典型表现。

sentences.english: They are in the business of democratizing technology.
sentences.chinese: 微软的主营业务是大众化技术。

sentences.english: The system is public application software in automotive parts sales areas.
sentences.chinese: 本系统是汽车配件销售行业适用的大众化软件。

sentences.english: Second, we seek out popular topics that teachers often request.
sentences.chinese: 我们会挑出老师经常提出的大众化课题。

sentences.english: They had the same experience of devoting to literature popularization .
sentences.chinese: 他们有一段迹近相似的献身文学大众化的经历。

sentences.english: Qu Qiubai and Mao Dun once contended with each other on the issue of popularization of literature.
sentences.chinese: 瞿秋白与茅盾曾就文艺大众化问题展开争鸣。

sentences.english: Television has displaced film as our country's most popular form of entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 电视已取代了电影，成为我国最大众化的娱乐形式。

sentences.english: In order to propagate the advanced culture, he put the popularization of drama into practice.
sentences.chinese: 他怀着传播先进文化的抱负，从事戏剧大众化的实验。

sentences.english: Bike is a common and popular traffic tool in China.
sentences.chinese: 自行车在中国是一种普通而又大众化的交通工具。

sentences.english: Proposed that the martial arts kick boxing movement takes road of the popular is its development steady road.
sentences.chinese: 武术散打运动走大众化之路，才是其发展的平稳之道。

sentences.english: Can be seen from the clothing, make-up side, both men and women in the pursuit of mass.
sentences.chinese: 可见，从衣着，化妆方面看，男女都在追求大众化。

sentences.english: Develop along with website developments flat-out quickly, the popularize degree is obvious to increase.
sentences.chinese: 随着网站建设发展速度的加快，大众化程度明显提高。

sentences.english: This restaurant offers meals at popular prices.
sentences.chinese: 〔这家饭店供应价格大众化的饭菜。

definition: minority of the population/non-mainstream (activity, pursuit etc)/niche (market etc)
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
folk songs of the state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]/popular art forms (cf. 陽春白雪|阳春白雪[yang2 chun1 bai2 xue3], highbrow art forms)
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
melodies of the elite in the state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]/highbrow art and literature
main stream (of a river)/fig. the essential point/main viewpoint of a matter/mainstream (culture etc)
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time
(idiom) to rely on a single authority to determine what is correct/to regard a source (or entity or individual) as the ultimate authority
